definition: to attend court/to take part in a trial
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
smile (archaic)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to examine/to investigate/carefully/to try (in court)
hearing (law)

sentences.english: A decision on whether the high court will hear the case is pending.
sentences.chinese: 对于是否由高级法院听审这个案件的决定尚未作出。

sentences.english: Najafi and Adams attended Sunday's hearing, but did not speak.
sentences.chinese: 纳杰菲和亚当斯于上周日出庭听审，但没有发言。

sentences.english: It was not indicated when the deposition might take place.
sentences.chinese: 没有任何文件说明听审将于何时举行。

definition: public trial (in a court of law)
to commit sb for trial/to bring sb for interrogation
to discuss together/to try to reach a common judgment/panel discussion
to visit (a meeting, class, trial etc)
in custody/to keep sb in detention
law court/hall (in castle)/CL:家[jia1]
to convict (sb of a crime)
public opinion/public announcement of verdict at a trial
to appear in court for trial (old)/(of Buddhist monks) to have a meal together in the temple hall
Ministry of Justice (in imperial China)
to judge a case
(Tw) judges and prosecutors
to open a law court/to set up a mourning hall
to re-investigate/to investigate and reconsider a judgment
judge (in court)
guilty
